Constructs a {{tt|year_month_weekday}} object.

@1@ Default constructor leaves the fields uninitialized.
@2@ Constructs a {{tt|year_month_weekday}} object storing the year {{c|y}}, the month {{c|m}}, the weekday {{c|wdi.weekday()}} and the weekday index {{c|wdi.index()}}.
@3@ Constructs a {{tt|year_month_weekday}} object corresponding to the date represented by {{c|dp}}. For any {{tt|year_month_weekday}} object storing a valid date, converting it to {{tt|sys_days}} and back yields the same value. This constructor defines an implicit conversion from {{tt|sys_days}} to {{tt|year_month_weekday}}.
@4@ Constructs a {{tt|year_month_weekday}} object corresponding to the date represented by {{c|dp}}. Equivalent to {{c|year_month_weekday(sys_days(dp.time_since_epoch()))}}.

===Notes===
A {{tt|year_month_weekday}} can also be created by combining one of the partial-date types {{lc|std::chrono::year_month}} and {{lc|std::chrono::month_weekday}} with the missing component (indexed weekday and year, respectively) using {{tt|operator/}}.
